intro: Senecio tafiensis, commonly known as the Tafiensis groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Senecio tafiensis is generally drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained conditions.
